title: Digital Marketing Analyst - CEMEA
description: The Digital Marketing Analyst will support digital marketing initiatives across the CEMEA (Central Europe, Middle East, and Africa) region. Responsibilities include analyzing digital campaign performance, tracking KPIs, generating insights from data, supporting SEO/SEM strategies, managing digital marketing tools, and collaborating with regional marketing teams to optimize digital presence and ROI.
requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Digital Marketing Analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical skills and experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics).
Experience with digital marketing platforms (Google Ads, social media advertising).
Proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
skills: Digital Marketing Analytics, Web Analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), Data Analysis, KPI Tracking, SEO/SEM (understanding), Google Ads, Social Media Advertising, Data Visualization (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), A/B Testing, Campaign Optimization, Excel (Advanced)

title: Policy Adviser and Translator (English ↔ Arabic)
description:
Application Deadline: 8pm, Saturday 21 June 2025 (Egypt time).
The role focuses on Egypt, Palestine, Algeria, Lebanon, Tunisia, and Libya political and economic analysis, promotion of New Zealand trade, regulatory analysis, and engagement with visiting New Zealand officials and businesses. Responsibilities include conducting high-quality research, synthesizing information, building networks, supporting visiting delegations, crafting social media content, managing scholarship offerings, translating official documents, interpreting in meetings, and drafting official correspondence.
requirements:
Ability to conduct high-quality political, trade, and economic research in Arabic and English.
Good network of contacts or ability to build them (government, parliament, private sector, academia, civil society).
Experience accompanying visiting delegations and supporting visit preparation.
Experience with social media content and public diplomacy initiatives.
Open-minded, curious, flexible, organized, independent thinker with initiative, proactive engagement, and informed opinions.
Positive outlook, good sense of humour, team player.
Right to work in Egypt.
skills: Political Analysis, Economic Analysis, Trade Promotion, Research (Arabic & English), Report Writing (English), Networking, Visit Coordination, Social Media Management, Translation (English ↔ Arabic), Interpretation (English ↔ Arabic), Diplomatic Correspondence, Initiative, Organization, Communication (written and spoken English & Arabic)

title: Programme Support Internship – Urban & Communications
description:
Duration: Approximately 6 months (Summer – flexible start date)
Responsibilities:
-Support the development and implementation of country strategies and regional programs
-Conduct research and prepare reports, briefs, and case studies
-Assist in organizing and coordinating events, meetings, and workshops (both virtual and in-person)
-Contribute to communication efforts, including social media and public outreach
-Compile and share best practices and lessons learned across regional projects
-Provide general administrative and programmatic support as needed

 Interns are responsible for covering the following:

-Travel costs
-Visa arrangements
-Accommodation
-Living expenses
-Medical insurance

Click here to view the official internship posting: 
https://unjobs.org/vacancies/1747770529203
requirements:
-Be enrolled in, or have recently graduated from, a graduate or undergraduate program (preferably in Urban Planning, Architecture, Political Science, International Relations, Development Studies, Communications, or a related field)
-Strong written and spoken English (Arabic is an asset)
-Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); knowledge of graphic design or social media tools is a plus
-Strong research, analytical, and organizational skills
-Ability to work independently and in a multicultural team environment
-Demonstrated interest in urban development, public policy, or international cooperation
skills: Strong communication skills – both written and verbal in English (Arabic is a plus) Research and analytical skills – ability to collect, organize, and analyze information Organizational skills – ability to manage tasks and meet deadlines independently Teamwork and collaboration – work effectively in a multicultural and international team Technical skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Basic knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Suite) is an advantage Familiarity with social media platforms and digital communication tools Attention to detail – especially when preparing briefs, reports, or presentations Adaptability and flexibility – open to working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

title: Senior Project Officer - Health & Nutrition
description: The Senior Project Officer-Health & Nutrition will lead and support the planning, implementation, and monitoring of health and nutrition projects. This includes community health initiatives, nutrition screening and support, health system strengthening activities, and promoting behavior change communication for improved health outcomes.
skills: Public Health Programming, Nutrition Interventions (e.g., CMAM, IYCF), Health System Strengthening, Behavior Change Communication (BCC), Project Management, Monitoring and Evaluation, Community Health Worker Training

title: Project Officer - Cash & Markets
description:
Application deadline is June 14, 2025

The Project Officer-Cash & Markets will support the design, implementation, and monitoring of cash-based interventions and market-based programming. This involves market assessments, feasibility studies for cash programming, vendor selection, cash distribution monitoring, and post-distribution monitoring, aiming to meet basic needs and support local markets.
skills: Cash Transfer Programming, Market Analysis, Voucher Systems, Mobile Money, Beneficiary Registration, Distribution Management, Monitoring and Evaluation, Data Analysis

title: Project Officer - Education
description: The Project Officer-Education will support the planning, implementation, and monitoring of education projects. This includes working with schools and communities, teacher training, curriculum adaptation (if applicable), and promoting inclusive and quality education for vulnerable children.
skills: Education Programming, Teacher Training, Curriculum Development (awareness), Child Protection in Education, Community Mobilization, Project Monitoring, Report Writing

title: Senior Project Officer - Partnerships
description:
Application deadline is June 14, 2025

The Senior Project Officer-Partnerships will be responsible for identifying, assessing, and managing relationships with local partners. This includes capacity strengthening, joint planning, monitoring partner performance, and ensuring compliance with CRS and donor regulations, fostering collaborative and effective partnerships.
skills: Partnership Management, Capacity Building, Stakeholder Engagement, Due Diligence, Grant Management, Project Cycle Management, Communication Skills, Negotiation Skills

title: Senior Project Officer - Livelihoods
description:
Application deadline is June 14, 2025

The Senior Project Officer-Livelihoods will lead and support the design, implementation, and monitoring of livelihood interventions. This includes market assessments, value chain analysis, skills training, enterprise development, and cash-based assistance, aiming to enhance the economic resilience of target communities.
skills: Livelihoods Programming, Market Assessment, Value Chain Development, Skills Training, Enterprise Development, Cash Transfer Programming, Project Management, Monitoring and Evaluation, Community Engagement

title: Project Officer - Protection
description:
Application deadline is June 14, 2025

The Project Officer-Protection will support the implementation of protection activities within CRS Egypt’s programs. This includes needs assessments, case management, referrals, awareness-raising, and capacity building of partners on protection principles and practices, ensuring the safety and dignity of vulnerable populations.
skills: Protection Principles, Case Management, Needs Assessment, Referral Pathways, Capacity Building, Community Mobilization, Report Writing, Child Protection, GBV Prevention/Response

title: Senior Project Officer - MEAL (Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability, and Learning)
description: The Senior Project Officer-MEAL will support CRS Egypt’s projects in delivering high-quality MEAL systems. This includes developing MEAL plans, tools, data collection, analysis, reporting, and ensuring accountability to beneficiaries. They will contribute to program learning and adaptive management.
skills: MEAL Systems, Data Collection, Data Analysis, Report Writing, Monitoring Tools, Evaluation Techniques, Accountability Mechanisms, Learning Facilitation, Project Management Support
